storyInfo: The Cautus Infected learns that the master of the ship she is on is called 'Priestess'. When Amiya crosses the boundary and runs into danger, the Doctor comes to her side. Together, they press onwards, helping each other along the way.

attributes.content: The Cautus has never thought that oncoming doom, especially one pressing down on their neck, could be something to be accepted calmly.
I-I could never be so indifferent if I had to live through everyone and everything I love being destroyed.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I don't understand how youâ€”
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: It's not indifference, but instead a belief in the absolute equality of the universe. It's a shame you arrived just a little bit late.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: This ship had just encountered a star going supernova several thousand light-years away and made a smooth withdrawal.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: If you see that sight with your own eyes, perhaps you will understand my meaning.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: The instruments in the hall begin to spin rapidly, until they are moving too fast for the Cautus to see with the naked eye.
Then, she sees a multitude of lights and shadows appear and float through the air.
I see a giant sphere emitting a deep, dark red light, and a small indigo dot speeding across its surface.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: But... it seems like it's the big sphere rotating around the blue dot?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The one you call the 'blue dot' is the pulsar that just went supernova I mentioned.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: The red star which is gradually being torn apart is its partner, now doomed to die as well.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: They once harbored many interesting primitive lifeforms. I have many fond memories of wandering through the planets of that star system.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: It's a pity they were snuffed out before they could see the world beyond the sky.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: ...Why are you showing this to me?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Simply sharing the knowledge we have with you, traveler.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: One-sided paranoia and ignorance are often barriers to effective information transfer. I have no knowledge of your history, either.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: The Cautus has barely had the time to comprehend these words before suddenly, her newly-acquired knowledge begins to assault her mind.
The land... may see life be born twice? These stars fallen from the sky... can harbor life of their own?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Ruination's end... is not despair.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: We're... not special, when it comes to the land?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: A celestial body that can sustain life loves all that live upon it equally, no matter where they hail from. This is a law of nature.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: Don't be too greedy in lapping up that knowledge you can't fully understand yet.
attributes.name: Mysterious Elf

attributes.content: I saw you among all that information. You once had many of your people by your side, but suddenlyâ€”
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: 'The Presence'. That's what a lot of people call you, right?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I am just a wandering presence, true. Like I said, when true destruction bore down on me and my fellows, I was powerless.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: ...What exactly is this destruction you keep talking about?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I've seen plenty of things here I can only describe as 'divine acts'. What could possibly threaten people like you?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I'm afraid that nobody on this ship can answer your question, traveler.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: In your eyes, we possess knowledge that many lifeforms in this universe would consider 'divine acts'...
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: But in this boundless cosmos, even we have limits to what we can explore and investigate.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: Are you disappointed?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: So there's definitely no eternal kingdom, a paradise where everyone can experience endless joy and happiness?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Would you like such a place to exist?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: The Cautus hesitates for a moment before nodding.

Nothing lives forever. Looking back through the history I know, I have come across legendary civilizations that have conquered countless star systems, spreading across the cosmos for millions of years.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: But as far as the universe cares, what they left behind was, in the end, utterly insignificant.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: We once blindly chased after non-existent principles and ideals... In the midst of that golden age beyond recollection, we believed our existences to have a sure purpose.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: But in the end?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: Any lifeform born with intelligence insists on declaring itself the center of its world, but whether or not it is right, in the universe's eyesâ€”
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: From start to finish, we are nothing. This is the first thing you must learn before you can understand it.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: Remember that brilliant supernova you just saw?
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: From that tomb, life will be born anew, and there will come a day when those beings will understand what we have carved on our grave.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: That we once had lives of our own. That we existed.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: ...I don't understand anything that you're saying.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: How were we born on this land?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Was there an even more glorious civilization here before us?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Are we going to be wiped out in the foreseeable future?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: But what I really want to know is, all this pain and suffering that Originium brings with it... Can it be eliminated?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I beg you, show me the way to the answers I seek...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I can't answer any of your questions. Your first three have been asked in a myriad of languages in a myriad of ways across the universe. Only you can answer them yourself.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: As for your final question... I'm terribly sorry, but I've never heard of this 'Originium', and I can't find anything related to it in our databases.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: However, I do know someone rather interesting, who also happens to be the master of this ship. Perhaps she will be able to solve your riddle.
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: The master of this ship?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: She's a linguist of wide renown. Her name isâ€”
attributes.name: The Presence

attributes.content: 'Priestess'.
No time to be lost in your thoughts, Doctor!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Grab onto me!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: â€”!;Did you see that, Amiya?

attributes.content: I can't break my focus right now. Weaving together a way to the singularity is incredibly difficult.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Even if Theresa were here to help...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Did you see something, Doctor?!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You see a familiar figure.

attributes.options: Keep focusing, Amiya.;Stick to the plan.;Keep building that 'bridge'!

attributes.content: I will! I'm doing everything I can right now to stabilize the connection points, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Theresa has marked all the records Dr. Kal'tsit searched through earlier. I'm trying to link them all together.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But I still need an anchor point, one that can guide me backâ€”
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I will keep watch here, and serve as your anchor.
attributes.name: Civilight Eterna

attributes.content: Press onwards, Amiya.
attributes.name: Civilight Eterna

attributes.content: Pink, silken threads begin to gather.
The meandering threads interweave and spiral, gradually spreading out from the boundary into the distance.
Beyond its walls, the path to the singularity slowly takes shape.
It's working!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Originium Arts don't seem to work here, but applying the logic behind casting them to the information here does!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Can you build the 'bridge' using completely unknown information?

attributes.content: No, this place is full of information I can't analyze, not even with the help of Civilight Eterna. I wouldn't have been able to make this way forward alone.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: But thankfully, Dr. Kal'tsit's access left records, and with Theresa's help, I can grasp onto her research data.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That's more than enough for me.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The pink threads continue to slowly spiral, linking together the many pieces of complex data that Kal'tsit left her mark on.
String by interwoven string, the path forward gradually forms.

attributes.text: 'I can tell how you're feeling, Kal'tsit.'

'By analyzing the emotional matrix I constructed of you without your permission, I see your tenseness is not only because of my sharing an appearance with Theresa. You have something even heavier on your mind.'
'I will try to adjust. I don't want my personal emotional changes to interfere with the objectivity of those who come after me when they query these records.'
'Yet they are still changing, Kal'tsit. Are you afraid?'

attributes.content: It's not the most efficient way to build a bridge, but it should hold.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'm going to try to get closer to the singularity.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I'll go with you.

attributes.text: 'I'm afraid Amiya and the Doctor won't be able to find the information I leave behind, and I'm afraid...'
'That if the situation worsens to the point that they are forced to take such extreme measures, the trail I cleared for them would no longer be of use...'
'Or that I might mistakenly lead these seekers of knowledge towards a threat I dare not speak of.'

attributes.content: No, Doctor. I won't let you, not before I check its condition myself.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Amiya...

attributes.content: Sorry, I know I'm being stubborn about it, but this is my decision.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The bridge, formed from countless strands of entwined information, stretches out into the distance to touch upon the singularity.
Without the slightest hesitation, Amiya steps onto it, her first step outside the walls of the boundaryâ€”
A surge.
This feeling, it's like the information has formed some sort of great wave. But whyâ€”
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: This is only the beginning, I'm afraid.;'The closer you get to the singularity, the denser the information will become.'

attributes.content: It really is like Theresa said. The information here has mass.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We'll most likely find greater resistance the deeper we go.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Come back for now, Amiya.;We need to come up with a better plan.

attributes.content: I can't maintain the stability of a bridge this weak. Going this deep has taken a greater toll than I expected.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I need to keep going forward. As long as I follow Dr. Kal'tsit's beacons...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The silver mountains the Teekaz had entered flit by her; the black shadow cast by the Feranmut plunging into icefield vanished momentarily.
She sees more scenes fly past her, as if she were fighting the current of the river of time.
More and more incomprehensible, indescribable sights assail her mind.
She does her best to block out the unending, chaotic stream of information.
Concentrate, Amiya, concentrate... Just keep focusing on Dr. Kal'tsit's beacons... Press onwards...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I just need to touch the singularityâ€”
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Silence.
Amiya cannot even hear her own breathing.
What... is this place?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That giant sphere... is disintegrating?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Looking at the shattered sphere makes her feel dizzy, but it is the bizarrely-shaped ship floating in the air that causes an even greater bout of lightheadedness.
What... is going on?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Why am I seeingâ€”
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: As she is trapped in her spell of dizziness, a rotating boulder slowly but inexorably hurtles towards her.
Its black shadow quickly fills Amiya's vision. She subconsciously tries to defend herself, but it is immediately followed by the feeling of freefall.
Did she fail...? Was it a surge of information?
'Amiya!'
...Doctor...?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I'm here.

attributes.content: Amiya senses a hand supporting her, keeping her thoughts steady by bracing her.

attributes.options: Try to block out the interfering information.;I've got you.
Hopefully I'm not too late.;Sorry, I couldn't sit back and do as I was told.

attributes.content: Doctor... Thank goodness...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: That moment just now...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You do your best to support her shaking body as the information wave surging from the singularity continues its assault.
The information, so dense it has nearly taken true shape, washes over your thoughts, leaving behind jumbled afterimages in the voidâ€”
It is the past long gone, the present being recorded en masse, and what seems to be the future, foreseeing your next steps.
It's a shame that right now, you do not have energy to spare to pay it any heed.
The two of you have already made the long, long, long trek from the boundary to this point without even noticing, and now, the singularity...
The singularity is right in front of you.
Did you see that terrifying scene earlier, Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I did.;I don't know what it means, though.

attributes.content: I'm certain it's not something that took place on Terra...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: But at least it means we're getting close to the singularity.;Even more information will show itself to us.
Can you still keep going, Amiya?

attributes.content: Y-Yes, yes I can.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You are well aware of the situation you are in right now. Despite knowing it will have minimal effect, you still subconsciously stretch out your arm to try and shield Amiya.

attributes.options: The attacks here are focused on our thoughts. I can handle it.;I'll be the vanguard.
I've got a lead on what we're here for.
I've run the calcs on Kal'tsit's access records.
You can read the key points from my mind.

attributes.content: Found them.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Using 'Slumber Bridge' as a filter, Dr. Kal'tsit conducted a total of 79,346 searches...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Although all the searches are related to 'Originium', according to your speculation, this data is not strongly related to its actual essential nature.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: If the results are restricted and give us nothing, doesn't the trail run cold here?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: No.
Kal'tsit retrieved the same entry over and over again.
This is, in itself, some information for us.

attributes.content: A repeated retrieval? Wait, can the infinitely-looping code made from the repeat query count be deciphered too?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: ...You already know the answer, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Yes, it's a familiar name.
Perhaps it's a sign...;Perhaps it's a warning...

attributes.content: I've never heard of this name. Neither you nor Dr. Kal'tsit has ever said it beforeâ€”
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: 'Priestess'?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: â€”Doctor, are you seeing what I'm seeing?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: ...I'm afraid... so...

attributes.content: 'Priestess...'
You have never seen this scene before, much less seenâ€”
(Unknown language) You're here, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: Is that...?;'Me'...?

attributes.content: (Unknown language) It took some time to refine your design for PRTS.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) I thought you had gone to take a rest.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) No, I've been thinking about your words this whole time.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) 'There is no language that can describe God, as the existence of God itself cannot be understood.'
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You know that was just mindless chatter.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Suppose I take it as an axiom.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) With it as my starting point, would creating a language that can describe God mean we have the means to understand It?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Does the prospect not excite you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Perhaps, in the pursuit of the answer to this question, we have been going down the wrong pathâ€”trying to understand the nature of the universe with its own laws.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (Unknown language) You want to use a language wholly created by us to interpret the universe. A far too audacious idea, Priestess.
attributes.name: Oracle

attributes.content: (Unknown language) Haha, is it?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Without any further hesitation, she traces out a perfect rhombus in the air.
(Unknown language) Let's begin, shall we?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: What are they discussing, Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You have seen this woman before in the Assimilated Universe. She once accompanied youâ€”

attributes.text: \n\nThat when you are truly confused by everything, you will remember: the answers you seek were here all along.

attributes.options: I'm afraid they're discussing...
Originium.
